greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = n + d(n), where d(n) = number of divisors of n, cf. A000005.
comment: Number of cyclic subgroups of dihedral group with 2n elements.
a(n) is the n-th smallest number not a divisor of n. - _J. Lowell_, Apr 06 2008
link: Harry J. Smith, Table of n, a(n) for n=1..1000
formula: a(n) = n + A000005(n). - _Omar E. Pol_, Dec 12 2008
program: (PARI) a(n) = n + numdiv(n) \\ _Harry J. Smith_, Aug 03 2009
a062249 n = a000005 n + n  -- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Mar 29 2014
[n + divisor_count(n) for n in range(101)] # _Indranil Ghosh_, Apr 12 2017
results.author: Ahmed Fares (ahmedfares(AT)my-deja.com), Jul 01 2001
ext: Formula and more terms from _Vladeta Jovovic_, Jul 03 2001
